Text:
[II] Beloved siblings, let us humbly implore Christ the Lord, born of the Virgin Mary, and let us call on Him with joy:
[IR] Come, Lord Jesus!
[I1] Only Son of God, who is coming to be the true messenger of the Covenant,
[I2] grant that creation welcomes and recognizes You.
[I1] You who was begotten within the Father's bosom, You took on flesh from the Virgin Mary,
[I2] cleanse us of the corruption of our human condition.
[I1] You who are life, came to endure death,
[I2] spare us from the terrors of our deaths.
[I1] And since your gift of salvation awaits us at the Judgement, might your constant tenderness be given us until then,
[I1] And Your gift of salvation awaits us at the Judgement, let Your constant tenderness be given today,
[I2] which gives relief to us for all our remaining days.
[I1] Lord Christ, by dying you helped all the dead,
[I2] we pray you welcome the deceased with tenderness.
Changes: 2021-12-06 - Paul Prins: Initial translation of these intentions.
